data.title: July Update
data.meta_description: This month's update introduces our newest Magistrate Judge, Steve B. Chu; provides links to our upcoming events; and more!
data.text:
San Diego FBA July Update

Connect with Us:

Trivia: What year was San Diego's first official Pride Parade held?

Judicial Update:

Steve B. Chu Appointed as U.S. Magistrate Judge

On June 30, 2023, the U.S. District Court judges appointed Steve B. Chu as a full-time U.S. Magistrate Judge. He is the first Asian American to serve as a magistrate judge in the Southern District. Read more about Judge Chu here.

Upcoming San Diego FBA Events

2023 Courtroom Conversation with

U.S. Magistrate Judge Lupe Rodriguez, Jr.

Tuesday, July 25, from 12:00 to 1:00 pm

Hybrid: United States Courthouse (El Centro) / Zoom Webinar

This hybrid Courtroom Conversation convenes in-person in El Centro, but attendees are also welcome to attend via Zoom. Attendees will have the opportunity to network and connect with Judge Rodriguez and colleagues, followed by a presentation on Judge Rodriguez's preferences and tips.

Cost: Free

Location: 2003 W. Adams Ave., El Centro, CA 92243 / or Zoom Webinar

MCLE: 0.5 hour of General CLE Credit

2023 Supreme Court Case Review

Featuring Dean Erwin Chemerinsky

Monday, July 31, from 12:00 to 1:00 pm

Zoom Webinar

Esteemed educator, litigator, and legal scholar Dean Erwin Chemerinsky will deliver an analysis of the 2022-23 United States Supreme Court term.

Cost: Free for FBA members; $10 for non-members (join today!)

MCLE: 1.0 hour of General CLE credit

San Diego FBA Summer Membership Mixer

Wednesday, August 30, 2023, from 5:00 to 6:30 p.m.

Judicate West, 402 West Broadway, Ste. 2400, San Diego, CA 92101

We are excited to mingle with you at the Chapter's summer mixer. Thank you to our Annual Sponsor, Judicate West, for hosting this event. RSVP Today!

19th Annual Judith N. Keep Federal Practice Seminar

Wednesday, September 20, 2023, from 1 to 6 p.m.

Westin Gaslamp Quarter, 910 Broadway Cir., San Diego, CA 92101

Please join us for the Nineteenth Annual Judith N. Keep Federal Practice Seminar, dedicated to the memory of former U.S. District Judge Judith N. Keep. This yearâ€™s seminar will feature a special video tribute featuring Hon. Ruben B. Brooks (Ret.), and panel presentations by several Southern District of California District Judges and Magistrate Judges.

The panels will focus on various aspects of pretrial and trial practice, including effective use of evidence, success with the Magistrate Judges, lesser-known strategies in federal court, and meeting the new District Judges.

Cost: Free, but space is limited: RSVP today!

CLE: 4.0 hours of General CLE credits

San Diego Federal Bar FoundationCharitable Golf and Pickleball Tournament

Monday, September 25, from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Lomas Santa Fe Country Club

Registration is openfor the Foundation's annual fundraiser benefiting the Open Doors to the Court Program; Foster Youth Golf Program; Crawford High School Academy of Law Foundation; Generate Hope; The Peter J. Mazza Outstanding Federal Attorney Award; and Federal Public Interest Law Scholarships. Email sdfedbarfoundation@gmail.com for more information on becoming a sponsor.

Save the Date!

Annual State of the Southern District Luncheon

Tuesday, October 17, 2023

Westin Gaslamp

Co-Sponsored Event:

The 2023 Mock Markman Competition

Registration Deadline Extended to July 31

Oral Arguments on Monday, October 19, 2023

Carter Keep United States Courthouse

Registration is openuntil July 31 to compete in the Mock Markman Competition for attorneys with six or less years of in practice. Participants will be assigned into teams of two to brief and argue the construction of four claim terms before judges of the United States District Court.

Did You Know? San Diego County has six American Inns of Court.

Community and National FBA Updates:

Interview with District Judge Andrew G. Schopler

San Diego FBA Board Member Jenn French and attorney Christian Andreu-von Euw of the California Lawyers Association Federal Courts Committee recently interviewed Judge Andrew G. Schopler. In this interview, Judge Schopler describes what led him to consider becoming a judge, his experience deploying on active duty in Afghanistan while serving as a U.S. Magistrate Judge, and his views on what makes a successful advocate.

Apply to Serve on National FBA Committees

The FBA will make appointments to its many committees for service beginning in fall of 2023. The FBA committees are charged with fulfilling our mission and providing benefits to our members and the public they serve. Apply by August 1, 2023.
